_header: God turn us every dream to good
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1988)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse Printed 1476-1558. London: Mansell, 1988, TP 506.5.
Subjects: Fame; Fortune; dreams; speech, advice concerning
_description: Chaucer’s Hous of Fame — 2158 lines in couplets (ends incomplete)

Bod638.First Lines:
God turne vs euery dreme to goodffor a ys wondre by the
                    rode…
Bod638.Last Lines: …Be he semyd for to beA man of grete auctoryte
Bod638.Attributed Title: The hows Of ffame (ff.141v-142 and RT)

BodFair16.First Lines:
GOd turne vs euery dreme to goodeffor hyt is wonder be the
                    Roode…
BodFair16.Last Lines:
…Thus in dreaming and in gameEnded this litel booke of
                    Fame
BodFair16.Attributed Title:
The house of ffame (f. 154v); Here endeth the booke of Fame (f.
                        183v)

CamMagPep2006.First Lines:
gOd turne vs euery drem to godeffor it is wonder thyng by þe
                    rode…
CamMagPep2006.Last Lines:
…Ma dam quod he soth to tellI am that ilk shrew I
                    wys…
CamMagPep2006.Attributed Title: Title added p. 91, top, but now trimmed and illegible.
